meanings.definition: To fade or diminish in advance.
meanings.sent1: The colors on the painting were prefading before our eyes.
meanings.sent2: The music slowly prefades into silence at the end of the song.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved prefading the image before making it disappear completely.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day prefaded like a dream upon waking.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight prefading behind the mountains painted a beautiful evening sky.

meanings.definition: The act of fading or diminishing in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prefading of the flowers signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent2: The prefading of the old photograph made it hard to see the faces clearly.
meanings.sent3: The prefading of the movie screen added a mysterious effect to the film.
meanings.sent4: The prefading of the colors in the sky hinted at an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The prefading of the music created a sense of anticipation in the audience.
